author: Staff Reporter
text:
The Pattali Makkal Katchi’s full-fledged election manifesto, which will be released shortly, will feature “a new social contract” between the government and the citizens, the party’s founder S. Ramadoss said.

Human rights based approach

“So long, the DMK and AIADMK governments have been acting like kings and queens, treating the people like their subjects. The government’s services have been handed down to people like charity. Such monarchic mindset should be brought to an end, and the PMK is putting forth a human rights based approach in TN politics,” he told reporters on Monday.

He added that the government services were the rights of people.

“The PMK will take a pledge to see that people are repository of sovereignty. In Tamil Nadu, the parties at the helm of the government have no respect for the social contract, on which a government is built,” he added.

Mr. Ramadoss observed that there has been no good governance, accountability and transparency in the State. He said the party will follow the principles of social democracy, and treat every individual as equal with no differences of religion, caste, language and gender.

Asked whether any party has approached PMK for alliance talks, he said that the BJP had approached them but refused to divulge any other information.

On reports that the multi-cornered fight might go in favour of the AIADMK, he termed them as rumours.
title: ‘Multi-cornered fight will not favour AIADMK’
